conclusion: Understand the relationship between velocity and displacement; velocity is inversely proportional to displacement.
Velocity at point A is 4 m/s, displacement from O to B is 2 m, velocity at point B is 2 m/s.
Need to find the time it takes for the detector to move from point A to point B.
Determine the relationship between velocity and displacement as v ∝ 1/d.
Calculate the displacement at point B using v ∝ 1/d, resulting in d = 4 m.
Calculate the time to move from point A to point B as displacement divided by velocity, resulting in 1 second.
